BackgroundFetchRegistration.summary: NOTE Experimental The BackgroundFetchRegistration interface of the represents an individual background fetch.

remarks.para: A BackgroundFetchRegistration instance is returned by the or methods, and therefore there has no constructor.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationAbort.summary: NOTE Experimental The abort() method of the interface aborts an active background fetch.
BackgroundFetchRegistrationAbort.returns: A that resolves with true if the fetch is successfully aborted.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationDownloaded.summary: NOTE Experimental The downloaded read-only property of the interface returns the size in bytes that has been downloaded, initially 0.

remarks.para: If the value of this property changes, the progress event is fired at the associated object.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationDownloadTotal.summary: NOTE Experimental The downloadTotal read-only property of the interface returns the total size in bytes of this download. This is set when the background fetch was registered, or 0 if not set.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationFailureReason.summary: NOTE Experimental The failureReason read-only property of the interface returns a string with a value that indicates a reason for a background fetch failure.

remarks.para: If the value of this property changes, the progress event is fired at the associated object.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationId.summary: NOTE Experimental The id read-only property of the interface returns a copy of the background fetch's ID.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationMatch.summary: NOTE Experimental The match() method of the interface returns the first matching .
BackgroundFetchRegistrationMatch.returns:
A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with the first that matches
the request or if no match is found.
NOTEBackgroundFetchRegistration.match() is basically identical to
, except that rather than resolving with an array of
all matching records, it resolves with the first matching record only.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationMatchAll.summary: NOTE Experimental The matchAll() method of the interface returns an array of matching objects.
BackgroundFetchRegistrationMatchAll.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with an array of all matching objects.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationProgress.summary: NOTE Experimental The progress event of the interface thrown when the associated background fetch progresses.

remarks.para: Practically, this event is fired when any of the following properties will return a new value:

BackgroundFetchRegistrationRecordsAvaila.summary: NOTE Experimental The recordsAvailable read-only property of the interface returns true if there are requests and responses to be accessed. If this returns false, then and can't be used.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationResult.summary: NOTE Experimental The result read-only property of the interface returns a string indicating whether the background fetch was successful or failed.

remarks.para: If the value of this property changes, the progress event is fired at the associated object.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationUploaded.summary: NOTE Experimental The uploaded read-only property of the interface returns the size in bytes successfully sent, initially 0.

remarks.para: If the value of this property changes, the progress event is fired at the associated object.

BackgroundFetchRegistrationUploadTotal.summary: NOTE Experimental The uploadTotal read-only property of the interface returns the total number of bytes to be sent to the server.
